new_world.setting: The Kingdom of Lumeris — City of Crystal Spires. An enigmatic metropolis built atop leyline nexuses, its skyline shimmers with iridescent towers of quartz and enchanted glass. Moonlight perpetually refracts through the spires, invoking shifting mosaics that cloak streets in mystic shadows.
new_world.era: Age of Arcana (pre-industrial magical era), spanning the late seventh cycle of the Kingdom’s lunar calendar.
new_world.technology_or_magic: Magic is entwined with technology. Personal artifacts — ‘soulbound relics’ — are the source and limit of individual magical power; these range from inherited combs to ancient blade fragments. Citizens are born with Arcane Gifts, expressed through enchanted hair, heirlooms, or bioluminescent light crystals. Artificial Intelligences (AI) from the founders’ era remain, ensconced in labyrinthine cores. All trade and labor are compensated in crystallized mana shards. Sacrificial acts of love literally alter one's magical resonance, enhancing or diminishing auras, sometimes permanently.
new_world.culture: Lumerians revere the balance of giving and taking; selflessness is considered the ultimate wisdom. Gift-giving, especially of parts of one’s soul relic, is culturally cherished but dangerous. Corporations are governed by councils of Mage-Executives who consult ancient AI ‘Elders’—sentient servers with relic interfaces. Maintenance engineers are a respected caste, permitted to commune with AI. Augmentations are rare, mostly auditory, and seen as a mark of near-sacrificial vocation. Social status correlates with aura vibrancy and the potency of soul relics.
new_world.tone: Mysterious, with currents of secret longing and the intangible price of devotion flowing beneath daily ritual.
world_rules: Magic is strictly bound to individual soul relics; overuse or gifting fragments weakens both magic and identity.
Mana shards are both currency and fuel for magic; running out leads to aura collapse.
Love-driven sacrifice viscerally impacts magical ability, visible through changes in aura color.
AI Elders cannot interact directly; they speak only through human intermediaries or mainframe avatars.
Maintenance areas are warded, filled with perceptible energy patterns and resonant server hums. Engineers with auditory augmentations experience these as near-painful symphonies.
Restoring a damaged relic is impossible; lost aura and magic are irretrievable.

character_mappings.narrative_purpose: Motivates the central act of selfless love, initiates plot through her sacrifice.

new_identity.name: Seris
new_identity.soul_relic: Cascading Veil of Auralight—her enchanted, bioluminescent hair that channels her unique magic.
new_identity.arcana_gift: Ability to attune and repair leyline harmonics through resonant song.
new_identity.status: Mana-poor, lower caste, respected for rare augmentations enabling AI communion.
new_identity.arc: From insecure and desperate to wise, eventually understanding that true worth is measured by the depth of love and sacrifice, not by material/arcane possessions.

character_mappings.narrative_purpose: Mirrors Della’s sacrifice, deepens emotional weight through reciprocal selflessness.

new_identity.name: Loras
new_identity.soul_relic: Celestial Chron—ancestral timepiece relic set with a fragment of sky crystal, source of his magical tracking and brief time-manipulation ability.
new_identity.arcana_gift: Can alter short-lived moments in time, dependent on the relic's magic.
new_identity.status: Hardworking, a humble provider, under strain to maintain his dwindling mana shards.
new_identity.arc: Learns that the loss of his greatest arcane asset in the service of love paradoxically strengthens, not weakens, his bond with Seris.

character_mappings.narrative_purpose: Catalyst for protagonist’s sacrifice, emotionless agent of transaction.

new_identity.name: Archivist Ysil
new_identity.profession: Relic Fragment Broker, affiliated with the Guild of Ethershard Appraisers
new_identity.soul_relic: Unremarkable—guilders rarely risk their own magic, specializing instead in dispassionate dealings.
new_identity.arcana_gift: Ability to appraise, fragment, and reweave minor soul relics for mana shards.
new_identity.status: Transactional, distant, strictly adheres to protocol.
new_identity.arc: No emotional development, remains a faceless functionary.

conflict_mappings.root_tension: Seris and Loras, deeply in love but suffering from acute mana-poverty, both seek to honor one another through meaningful, arcane-gifted presents for the Festival of Silver Moons. Both secretly plan sacrificial acts to obtain these gifts.
new_expression: Seris sells a rare fragment of her Veil of Auralight—diminishing her personal magic and reducing her aura’s brilliance—trading it at the Guild of Ethershard for enough mana shards to commission a bespoke starlight chain for Loras’ Celestial Chron.

Loras, in parallel secrecy, brokers his family’s Celestial Chron (his only conduit to time-magic) to an arcane artificer, acquiring enough condensed mana to purchase an Opaline Comb of Harmonizing, meant to amplify the resonance in Seris’s Veil of Auralight.
Upon the exchange, both realize they have sacrificed their soul relics for the other’s happiness, granting each a gift now rendered functionally useless.
The futility and beauty of their mirrored sacrifices—both have irretrievably reduced their magical potential for love—embody the core irony and emotional impact.

preserved_dynamics.structure: Devoted couple bound by reciprocal sacrifice; each act is a mirror of the other's selflessness.
preserved_dynamics.motivations: Determination to honor the beloved through profound personal loss, driven by love rather than material calculation.
preserved_dynamics.emotional_arc: Desperation > Secret sacrifice > Painful revelation > Enlightened embrace of love’s true value.

preserved_dynamics.structure: Transactional; Ysil enables Seris’s self-sacrifice without emotional attachment.
preserved_dynamics.emotional_arc: No change; serves as a narrative agent of inevitability.
